titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lee Wilson Dodd Papers
titlestmt.author: by Lisa Conathan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:55

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material created by and relating to Lee Wilson Dodd, documenting his career as a playwright and author of fiction. The bulk of the collection consists of drafts and circulating versions of playscripts and other writings by Dodd (including a draft of a single novel, Mouse). Also included are two folders of correspondence, one folder of playbills, and one folder of photographic negatives.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jack Crawford, 1952, and Alan Dodd, 1953.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 8: (Cold storage)(Photographic negatives): Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Lee Wilson Dodd Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lee Wilson Dodd Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit. This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, in 2013. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from existing catalog cards. This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Lee Wilson Dodd
bioghist.p: Lee Wilson Dodd (1879-1933), Yale College 1899, Law School 1902, American playwright and author of fiction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Writings, 1904-1934. II. Other Papers, 1902-1932.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically. Poems, notes, and two untitled play scenarios are filed at the end of the sequence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of drafts and circulating versions of writings of Lee Wilson Dodd, including plays (full scripts and scenarios), essays and short stories.

did.unittitle: The Boy and the Book (playscript), typescript
Brown Stone Boyhood (short story), typescript, corrected
Great and Little Things (short story), typescript
Insane Angels (essay), typescript and related correspondence
Lavengro (playscript), autograph manuscript and typescript carbon
Merrymount (opera libretto), typescript, with accompanying correspondence
Modesty (playscript), by Paul Hervieu, translated by Lee Wilson Dodd, typescript
The Reckless Age (playscript), six versions, autograph manuscript and typescript
Saving Judy (playscript), two versions, typescript carbon
Seeing Red with Ronny (playscript), two versions, typescript
Some Thoughts on Democratic Art (essay), autograph manuscript
A Stranger in the House (playscript), four versions, typescript and carbon
A Strong Man's House (playscript), two versions, typescript carbon
Things Are Seldom So Nice (short story), typescript
The Vision of Tristram Dane (playscript), autograph manuscript and typescript
Notes and fragments of writings, autograph manuscript and typescript
"Scenario of a play in four acts," typescript
"Scenario of a new play," typescript carbon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of correspondence, printed ephemera, and photographic negatives.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, chiefly relating to Golden Complex and Book of Susan
Printed ephemera: playbills and one publisher's announcement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs consist landscapes and portraits of unidentified people, some of which appear to be in Mexico.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
